Description: Portrait of man on painted plaster mask mounted on linen base; also hardwood mummy-label bearing painted Greek text and with attached cord of painted linen.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Henri Édouard Naville (1893-94, on behalf of EEF)
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, pp. 192-193 [144]. Riggs, in Strudwick and Taylor (eds.): The Theban Necropolis (2003). [pl.108] Riggs, Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt (2005): 232-3, 234 Fig. 117, 235, 300 J.H. Taylor & D. Antoine, Ancient lives, new discoveries, London 2014, p. 147. See bibliographic record: Nachtergael 2003, 267; Parlasca and Seeman 1999, no. 240); Wagner 1995. D. Antoine and M. Vandenbeusch, Egyptian mummies. Exploring ancient lives, Sydney 2016, pp. 182-3.
Bibliographic references: Nachtergael 2003 / Étiquettes de momies: Éditions, notes critiques, bibliographie (no. 14 (p.267, fig.3).) (edition of mummy label)
Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (no. 240 (p.351).) (incl. plate)
Wagner 1995 / Encore Terkythis. Étiquette de momie BM 26273
Riggs 2005 / Beautiful burial in Roman Egypt (no.147, fig.117)
Exhibition history: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2016-2017 10 Oct-30 Apr, Sydney, Powerhouse Museum, Ancient Lives 2017 16 Jun-18 Oct, Hong Kong Science Museum, Ancient Lives 2017-2018 14 Nov-20 Feb, Taiwan, National Palace Museum, Ancient Lives 2018 16 Mar-22 Jul, Brisbane, Queensland Museum of Art, Ancient Lives 2019-2020 14 Sept- 28 Jun, Montreal, Museum of Fine Arts, Ancient Lives EXTENDED DUE TO COVID19 2020-2021, 19 Sept - 21 Mar, Toronto, Royal Ontario Museum, Ancient Lives
Associated places: Named in inscription: Kom Abu Billo
